title: Millie Pasquinelli's Fried Chicken Recipe
description: This fried chicken recipe without buttermilk uses seasoned flour and beaten egg to create a deliciously crispy coating and juicy chicken every time!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Fried Chicken Recipes Millie Pasquinelli's Fried Chicken 4.8 (306) 254 Reviews 95 Photos This fried chicken recipe without buttermilk is easy to make with simple pantry ingredients. The chicken is fried to perfection and comes out juicy every time. Mouthwatering, and especially delicious when served with homemade ravioli and sauce on the side. Submitted by SUE PASQUINELLI Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 95 95 95 95 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 3 cups all-purpose flour 5 tablespoons seasoned salt 3 tablespoons garlic powder salt and pepper to taste 4 large eggs, beaten 2 (2 to 3 pound) whole chickens, cut into pieces 1 quart vegetable oil for frying Directions Mix flour, seasoned salt, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a shallow plate or bowl. Place eggs in a separate shallow bowl. Roll or shake chicken pieces in the flour mixture and place on a platter. Then dip each chicken piece in the egg and roll again in the flour mixture. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Fry coated chicken pieces in hot oil for about 5 minutes on each side. Cover skillet and cook on lower heat for about 10 minutes. Remove cover, turn up the heat, and fry for 5 minutes on each side to make chicken crispy. Chicken is done when it is no longer pink inside and its juices run clear. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Drain fried chicken on paper towels and keep warm in an oven until ready to serve. Editor's Note: Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary. We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used. I Made It Print 533 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 622 Calories 38g Fat 27g Carbs 41g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 622 % Daily Value * Total Fat 38g 49% Saturated Fat 10g 49% Cholesterol 204mg 68% Sodium 1304mg 57% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 1g Protein 41g 82% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 60mg 5% Iron 4mg 21% Potassium 462mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Millie Pasquinelli's Fried Chicken 01 of 95 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 95 Photo by  Janet Welch 04/02/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort Family favorite Crowd-pleaser Easy to follow This is the first fried chicken that I’ve made that they all loved. Thank you Millie! Great instructions easy to make. If you have teenage boys, make double! 03 of 95 Photo by  mroger82 07/01/2021 04 of 95 Photo by  Jacqueline Fernandez 03/13/2021 I cut the recipe in half, I had 6 frozen drum sticks I left out to thaw. Fried them up and still had mix left. So I cut up two zucchini’s and fried them up with the left over mix. Best fried chicken I’ve ever had!! I did add a little bit of Cheyenne pepper to give a kick. Not too much, because I can’t handle the spicy. 05 of 95 Photo by  Jennifer Freds 01/17/2021 06 of 95 Photo by  KJ0hn 12/27/2020 First time making fried chicken. Fried in a cast iron pan. Turned out great. On my stove I had to use just over medium heat and just above simmer in order to not overcook the chicken. 07 of 95 Photo by  Kassidy Eagle Road 12/26/2020 08 of 95 Photo by  Cookinmomma26 11/02/2020 Great recipe. Love how my chicken came out golden brown and crunchy. 09 of 95 Photo by  Raechael 10/26/2020 Made this as directed. Amazing!!! I changed the portions for just 3 servings because it was just my husband and I. Used about 1.5 tsp. for the regular salt. Came out just right. I wasn’t sure where to set my stovetop to achieve the 365° temp so I googled and it said med high on a regular electric stove. Since I was cooking on a propane stovetop I set it between 2 and 3 because it cooks much hotter and it turned out great! This will be my new fried chicken staple! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Better than Best Fried Chicken 628 Ratings Honey-Brined Fried Chicken Breasts 204 Ratings Deep South Fried Chicken 275 Ratings Firecracker Fried Chicken Drumsticks 247 Ratings Crispy Southern Fried Chicken 175 Ratings Mamaw's Southern Buttermilk Chicken 17 Ratings Southern-Style Buttermilk Fried Chicken 188 Ratings Crispy Fried Chicken 799 Ratings Unbelievable Chicken 2,423 Ratings Honey Mustard Grilled Chicken 2,589 Ratings Key West Chicken 1,574 Ratings Cornell Chicken 85 Ratings Chef John's Barbecue Chicken 162 Ratings Ray's Chicken 273 Ratings Greek Chicken 495 Ratings Marinated Greek Chicken Kabobs 314 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: SUE PASQUINELLI
instructions: Mix flour, seasoned salt, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a shallow plate or bowl. Place eggs in a separate shallow bowl.;Roll or shake chicken pieces in the flour mixture and place on a platter. Then dip each chicken piece in the egg and roll again in the flour mixture.;Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Fry coated chicken pieces in hot oil for about 5 minutes on each side. Cover skillet and cook on lower heat for about 10 minutes. Remove cover, turn up the heat, and fry for 5 minutes on each side to make chicken crispy. Chicken is done when it is no longer pink inside and its juices run clear. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).;Drain fried chicken on paper towels and keep warm in an oven until ready to serve.
